result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W Bruss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Release for standard conditions if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence
May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with any co-actors or victims. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Dated 08/09/16, from DOC to Judge Carter, requesting clarification of sentence.  Sent to Judge Carter for review.
Sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael W Bruss in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Weitzner requests an adjourned date for sentencing.  Court adjourns sentencing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael W Bruss in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Weitzner requests to set case for jury trial. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael W Bruss in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney WEitzner requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael W Bruss in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests an adjournment as he has not heard back from the state on counteroffer.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael W Bruss in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests an adjournment as he was just assigned to this case.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Michael W Bruss in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
